trans-unit.source: Securing the MOF File
trans-unit.target: Securing the MOF File

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: DSC tells the target nodes what configuration they should have by sending a MOF file with that information to each node, where the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) implements the desired configuration.
trans-unit.target: DSC tells the target nodes what configuration they should have by sending a MOF file with that information to each node, where the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) implements the desired configuration.

trans-unit.source: Because this file contains the details of the configuration, it’s important to keep it secure.
trans-unit.target: Because this file contains the details of the configuration, it’s important to keep it secure.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you can set the Local Configuration Manager to check the credentials of a user.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you can set the Local Configuration Manager to check the credentials of a user.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to transmit those credentials securely to the target node by encrypting them with certificates.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to transmit those credentials securely to the target node by encrypting them with certificates.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To successfully encrypt the credentials used to secure a DSC configuration, make sure you have the following:
trans-unit.target: To successfully encrypt the credentials used to secure a DSC configuration, make sure you have the following:

trans-unit.source: Some means of issuing and distributing certificates.
trans-unit.target: Some means of issuing and distributing certificates.

trans-unit.source: This topic and its examples assume you are using Active Directory Certification Authority.
trans-unit.target: This topic and its examples assume you are using Active Directory Certification Authority.

trans-unit.source: For more background information on Active Directory Certificate Services, see <linkText>Active Directory Certificate Services Overview</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Active Directory Certificate Services in Windows Server 2008</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more background information on Active Directory Certificate Services, see <linkText>Active Directory Certificate Services Overview</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Active Directory Certificate Services in Windows Server 2008</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Administrative access to the target node or nodes.
trans-unit.target: Administrative access to the target node or nodes.

trans-unit.source: Each target node has an encryption-capable certificate saved its Personal Store.
trans-unit.target: Each target node has an encryption-capable certificate saved its Personal Store.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell, the path to the store is Cert:\LocalMachine\My.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell, the path to the store is Cert:\LocalMachine\My.

trans-unit.source: The examples in this topic use the “workstation authentication” template, which you can find (along with other certificate templates) at [Default Certificate Templates](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc740061(v=WS.10).aspx).
trans-unit.target: The examples in this topic use the “workstation authentication” template, which you can find (along with other certificate templates) at [Default Certificate Templates](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc740061(v=WS.10).aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you will be running this configuration on a computer other than the target node, export the public key of the certificate, and then import it to the computer you will run the configuration from.
trans-unit.target: If you will be running this configuration on a computer other than the target node, export the public key of the certificate, and then import it to the computer you will run the configuration from.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you export only the public key; keep the private key secure.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you export only the public key; keep the private key secure.

trans-unit.source: Overall process
trans-unit.target: Overall process

trans-unit.source: Set up the certificates, keys, and thumbprints, making sure that each target node has copies of the certificate and the configuration computer has the public key and thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Set up the certificates, keys, and thumbprints, making sure that each target node has copies of the certificate and the configuration computer has the public key and thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration data block that contains the path and thumbprint of the public key.
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration data block that contains the path and thumbprint of the public key.

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration script that defines your desired configuration for the target node and sets up decryption on the target nodes by commanding the Local Configuration manager to decrypt the configuration data using the certificate and its thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration script that defines your desired configuration for the target node and sets up decryption on the target nodes by commanding the Local Configuration manager to decrypt the configuration data using the certificate and its thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: Run the configuration, which will set the Local Configuration Manager settings and start the DSC configuration.
trans-unit.target: Run the configuration, which will set the Local Configuration Manager settings and start the DSC configuration.
